root: ^Trout: Hello Alex! It's about time you came around.

c-0: ^ You: Were you waiting for me?
c-1: ^ You: "About time"? What do you mean?
g-0: ^Trout: The whole island has been waiting for you to arrive.

main: ^Trout: If those are all your questions, I'm going to continue on with my work.

c-0: ^ You: What a nice beach. Is this where you live?
^Trout: Yes. It used to be a nice beach. Now it's just a ruin full of rocks, dirt, and a receding shoreline.
c-1: ^ You: I'm sorry, but who are you?
^Trout: I am the island's fisher, Trout. I am responsible for the entire island's supply of fish.
c-2: ^ You: Can I help you with your work?
^Trout: Seeing as you are not a fisher, you won't be able to do much for me. Still, I could use your help. I've lost my fishing gloves, and without them, I can't fish. Can you help me find them?
c-3: ^ You: Can you tell me about this island?
^Trout: The name of this Island is Atua Motu. It is full of many mysteries. Atua Motu is run by the effort of all the animals that live here.
c-4: ^ You: Good luck, and thanks for talking with me. Bye!

quest: ^Trout: I think I left my fishing gloves somewhere around the beach. Please hurry! I need them to fish.

c-0: ^ You: Here are the fishing gloves you were looking for.
^Trout: Thank you for completing my quest!
c-1: ^Please do. I know I left them nearby.

other_quest_active: ^Trout: Looks like you're busy with something else. Come talk to me when you're done.
after_quest: ^Trout: You've been so helpful to me, so I will give you some valuable information.

c-0: ^Trout: These island's inhabitants aren't what they seem. We are human spirits trapped in the only hosts that would welcome us: the animals of this island.
^Trout: Be careful about who you trust. I don't think that Forest Ranger is going to be much help to you.
^Trout: This might not make sense yet, but remember to be assertive with Ochano. He will respect your bravery.
^ You: Thanks! I'll keep that in mind.
